I'm terrified of being asked about complex autoimmune cases. What if I miss something important? This post helps so much!
The question I fear most: 'Why isn't this working?' after weeks of following a protocol. What do you do when progress stalls?
Thank you for this Sarah! I literally almost didn't sign up because I felt like I didn't know enough. This permission to learn alongside clients is everything.
My biggest fear: hormone questions! The endocrine system feels SO complex. But you're right - I can always research and come back!
I'm afraid clients will ask about medication interactions. I always say 'please discuss with your prescribing doctor' but worry they'll think I'm incompetent.
This is EXACTLY what I needed to hear today. I've been putting off reaching out to potential clients because I don't feel ready enough.
The gut-brain connection questions scare me! It's such a new and evolving field. But I guess that's the beauty of functional medicine - we're all learning!
I fear questions about specific lab values. What's optimal vs just normal? Still learning to interpret everything confidently.
My worst fear: 'My doctor says functional medicine is pseudoscience.' How do you handle the skeptics?
Thank you Sarah! I've turned down 3 potential clients because I felt 'not ready yet.' Reading this makes me realize I was self-sabotaging.
Questions about children's health terrify me! The stakes feel so much higher with little ones.
I'm scared of the 'but I've tried everything' clients. What if I can't help them either?
This brought tears to my eyes. I've been so paralyzed by fear of not knowing enough. Permission to be human granted! üôè
Cancer-related questions are my fear. I know we can support but not treat, but the conversations are so delicate.
What if someone asks about a condition I've never heard of? This happens more than I'd like to admit!
I'm most afraid of 'how long will this take?' Because everyone's different and I don't want to overpromise.
Mental health questions scare me - the overlap with physical health is so important but I worry about scope of practice.
This community is everything! Just knowing others feel this way makes me braver. We're all in this together!
I fear being compared to their doctor. 'Well my doctor said...' and then I freeze up.
Pregnancy questions! So many things change and the research is always evolving. But you're right - honesty is key.
What about when clients want to stop their medications? That's a minefield I'm not sure how to navigate.
THANK YOU. I printed this and put it on my wall. The imposter syndrome has been REAL.
My fear: 'Can you guarantee results?' Because obviously I can't, but I want them to trust me.
Questions about specific supplements scare me - there are SO many and the quality varies so much!
I'm afraid of 'why didn't my other health coach help me?' Because what if I'm just as ineffective?
This is so validating! I thought I was the only one feeling this way. Thank you for normalizing it Sarah!
Thyroid questions are my nemesis! So many factors involved and everyone's journey is different.
What if they ask for references or studies? I know the science but I'm not great at citing specific papers on the spot.
My biggest fear is disappointing someone who's put their trust and money into working with me. What if I let them down?
Elderly client questions worry me - so many medications, so many complications, so much history to understand.
I fear 'what makes you different from everyone else?' I'm still figuring out my unique approach!
Thank you Sarah! The 'research and get back to you' approach is genius. It shows thoroughness, not weakness.
Weight loss questions stress me out. So emotional for clients and so complex in reality.
What about when they're already working with another practitioner? Do I step on toes?
LOVE THIS! I've been waiting to feel '100% ready' and you just called me out. Time to take action!
Questions about mold illness terrify me. It's so complex and controversial even in functional medicine circles.
I'm scared of 'can you cure me?' Because we don't cure, we support healing. But that distinction is hard to explain.
This whole comment section is giving me life! We're all beautifully imperfect and that's OKAY!
Fertility questions are my fear - the emotional weight of those conversations is heavy.
What if they've been to 10 practitioners before me and nothing worked? The pressure!
I literally cried reading this. I've been holding myself back for months. Today that changes. Thank you Sarah! üíï
Questions about kids with behavioral issues scare me. Parents are desperate and I want to help but the research is complex.
My biggest fear is saying something wrong that could actually harm someone. The responsibility feels enormous.
This community support is amazing! I came here feeling alone and now I feel like part of a family.
Chronic fatigue questions are tough - so many possible root causes and it's hard to know where to start.
What if they expect me to diagnose? I have to be so careful with language around that.
You just changed my whole mindset with this post Sarah. Sharing vulnerability IS strength!
SIBO questions make me nervous - so much contradicting information out there!
I fear 'my friend had a bad experience with a health coach.' Overcoming that bias is hard.
Taking a screenshot of this post! Reading it every time I feel like a fraud. THANK YOU!
Questions about genetic mutations (MTHFR etc.) still make me sweat. So much to know!
My fear: 'I need someone with more experience.' How do you handle that objection?
This whole thread is therapy! I thought I was uniquely unqualified. Turns out we all feel this way at first!
Heavy metal questions are intimidating - the testing and protocols are so specialized.
What about when they've been gaslit by doctors for years? The emotional labor of those sessions is real.
Screenshotting this whole post and all the comments. Gold mine of reassurance and wisdom!
Lyme disease questions terrify me - it's so complex and often co-infections are involved.
I'm afraid they'll think I'm not 'scientific' enough compared to their MD. Functional medicine IS science!
Just booked my first discovery call after reading this. Fear is not going to win today! üôå
Adrenal fatigue questions - is it even real? How do I explain the controversy to clients?
My fear is being asked for a specific protocol and not having one ready. But that's what personalization is about, right?
This post + these comments = exactly what my imposter syndrome needed. We're all learning together!
Questions about combining functional medicine with conventional treatment are tricky. How do you navigate that?
I'm scared of 'I need results FAST.' Because real healing takes time and I can't rush biology.

Histamine intolerance questions are my weak spot. Still learning so much about it!
